column2: The buzz of nervous chatter ceased at six minutes to eleven when a tall, elegant man in morning dress entered the room, came to a halt at the foot of the step, and turned to face the assembled gathering.

10:54 GMT
"Commander Hawksby's office."
"It's Bruce Lamont, Angela. Can you put me through to the boss?"
"He's still in Italy, Bruce. I'm not expecting him back until Monday."
It was 10:54 A.M. Her telephone call would come in a minute. They were at different times each morning and she had a plastic laminated chart that told her what time to expect the call on each day.

I'm telling you that you paid 6,495 into Bennington's Bank in the High Street at 10:54 a.m. today, insisted Frost.
"And I'm telling you I did not" spat the man.
